intro: Gomphrena meyeniana var. tucumanensis, commonly known as the Tucumán gomphrena, is a flowering plant native to South America, particularly Argentina. It is characterized by its striking, spiky inflorescences that range in color from red to pink and purple. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky areas. It has small, narrow leaves and is often cultivated for its ornamental value. The species is part of the Amaranthaceae family, which includes other plants with showy flowers and succulent stems.
